name: Bandwidth and Q Factor
explanation: Bandwidth (BW) is the range of frequencies a circuit passes, typically measured between -3dB points (half-power points). The quality factor (Q) measures how selective a resonant circuit is - higher Q means narrower bandwidth and better frequency selectivity. Q = f₀/BW, where f₀ is the resonant frequency. High Q circuits are used in radio tuning, filters, and oscillators where frequency selectivity is important.

examples.problem: A resonant circuit has f₀ = 1MHz and Q = 100. What is the bandwidth?
A filter has 100kHz center frequency and 5kHz bandwidth. What is Q?
